IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE AMERICAN FLORAL ENDOWMENT IS A NOT FOR PROFIT CORPORATION THAT RAISES AND PRUDENTLY INVESTS ITS FUNDS TO SUPPORT PRODUCTION AND MARKET RESEARCH AND EDUCATION PROGRAMS TO BENEFIT THE FLORICULTURE INDUSTRY. AFE IS DEVOTED TO THE AQUISITION AND DISSEMINATION OF FUNDS DESIGNATED FOR THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION AND SCIENCE IN THE FLORICULTURE AND ENVIRONMENTAL HORTICULTURAL FIELD. ITEMS FUNDED BY THE ENDOWMENT INCLUDE RESEARCH AND STUDIES, SCHOLARSHIPS, INTERNSHIPS, AND OTHER EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE AMERICAN FLORAL ENDOWMENT IS A NOT FOR PROFIT CORPORATION THAT RAISES AND PRUDENTLY INVESTS ITS FUNDS TO SUPPORT PRODUCTION AND MARKET RESEARCH AND EDUCATION PROGRAMS TO BENEFIT THE FLORICULTURE INDUSTRY. AFE IS DEVOTED TO THE ACQUISITION AND DISSEMINATION OF FUNDS DESIGNATED FOR THE ADVANCEMENT OF EDUCATION AND SCIENCE IN THE FLORICULTURE AND ENVIRONMENTAL HORTICULTURAL FIELD. ITEMS FUNDED BY THE ENDOWMENT INCLUDE RESEARCH AND STUDIES, SCHOLARSHIPS, INTERNSHIPS, AND OTHER EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES.
IRS990.Desc: SCIENTIFIC GRANTS: PROVIDE FUNDING FOR RESEARCH ON CURRENT ISSUES AFFECTING THE FLORICULTURE INDUSTRY.EDUCATIONAL GRANTS: PROVIDE GRANTS TO PROGRAMS PROMOTING THE FLORICULTURE INDUSTRY, AND THOSE THAT SUPPORT STUDENTS PURSUING CAREERS IN VARIOUS CONCENTRATIONS WITHIN THE FLORICULTURE INDUSTRY.

OtherSecuritiesGrp.Desc: NORTHERN TRUST PRIVATE EQUITY FUND III, V, VII, VIII
NORTHERN TRUST ALPHA CORE STRATEGIES FUND

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PERMANENTLY RESTRICTED NET ASSETS ARE DESIGNATED FOR SCHOLARSHIPS.

GAAP REQUIRES ENTITIES TO EVALUATE, MEASURE, RECOGNIZE, AND DISCLOSE ANY UNCERTAIN INCOME TAX POSITIONS TAKEN ON THEIR TAX RETURNS. GAAP PRESCRIBES A MINIMUM THRESHOLD THAT A TAX POSITION IS REQUIRED TO MEET IN ORDER TO BE RECOGNIZED IN THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS. AFE BELIEVES THAT IT HAD NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS AS DEFINED IN GAAP.

EDUCATION GRANTS AND PHILLIP SCHOLARSHIP GRANTS

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PROGRESS REPORTS AND CONTINUING FUNDING APPLICATIONS ARE REQUIRED FOR ALL GRANTS. THESE ARE REVIEWED ANNUALLY BY BOARD COMMITTEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS REVIEWED BY THE ACCOUNTANT AND THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. ANY REQUIRED CHANGES ARE DISCUSSED WITH THE TAX AUDITORS AND THE REVISED COPY IS SENT BACK TO THE ACCOUNTANT AND THE EXECUTIVE FOR A SECOND REVIEW. A COPY OF THE FORM 990 IS PROVIDED TO THE TRUSTEES PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CONFLICT-OF-INTEREST POLICY APPLIES TO TRUSTEES, OFFICERS, AND STAFF MEMBERS. ALL COVERED INDIVIDUALS ARE REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE POTENTIAL CONFLICTS ANNUALLY BY COMPLETING A DISCLOSURE FORM. THESE QUESTIONNAIRES ARE REVIEWED AND MONITORED BY THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE ORGANIZATION OR THE BOARD OF TRUSTEES. FOR INDIVIDUALS WITH POTENTIAL CONFLICTS, A DECISION IS MADE WHETHER TO WAIVE THE POTENTIAL CONFLICT IF IT IS DEEMED NOT TO HAVE A MATERIAL IMPACT, RECUSE THE INDIVIDUAL FROM ALL DELIBERATIONS AND DECISION MAKING RELATED TO THE PARTICULAR TRANSACTION OR WHETHER THE INDIVIDUAL SHOULD RESIGN FROM SERVICE TO AFE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE CHAIRMAN AND PAST CHAIRMAN HAVE THE PRIMARY RESPONSIBILITY TO PERFORM THE ANNUAL REVIEW OF THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR. THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR WILL SUBMIT TO THE CHAIRMAN AND PAST CHAIRMAN HER ANNUAL SELF-EVALUATION, NO LATER THAN MAY 15TH OF EACH YEAR. THE CHAIRMAN AND PAST CHAIRMAN WILL REVIEW THIS DOCUMENT AND THE CHAIRMAN WILL CONDUCT A REVIEW WITH THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR TO ANSWER ANY QUESTIONS AND DISCUSS PERFORMANCE. FOLLOWING THIS DISCUSSION/MEETING, THE CHAIRMAN WILL SHARE THE SELF-EVALUATION AND DISCUSSION WITH THE PAST CHAIRMAN, AND THEY WILL JOINTLY MAKE A RECOMMENDATION TO THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE. THEY WILL ALSO HAVE ACCESS TO SALARY, BENEFITS, SURVEY INFORMATION CONDUCTED ANNUALLY BY THE AMERICAN SOCIETY OF ASSOCIATION EXECUTIVES (ASAE), IN ORDER TO ENSURE COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS ARE FAIR AND WITHIN THE ASSOCIATION PROFESSION. THIS FULL PROCESS OF THE ANNUAL REVIEW OF THE EXECUTIVE DIRECTOR SHOULD BE COMPLETED PRIOR TO THE END OF AFE'S FISCAL YEAR (JUNE 30).

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ENDOWMENT MAKES THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE UPON WRITTEN REQUEST.
